answers.answer: You don't want to make it go faster, 34 weeks is still VERY early regardless of the steroid shots and if born now he will likely be in the NICU and have breathing/swallowing problems. Stress is hard, but pregnancy isn't about having that child to fit our schedule, it's about giving them the best chances. It's not comfortable, and it never will be. There's a child pressing up against every organ and your body, and the pressure it adds on your lower limbs is unbearable at times. I spent my entire pregnancy vomiting 24/7 and when I wasn't, I was nauseated and praying I wouldn't be sick. He'll come when he's ready to come, even though you might already be.

I'm sorry you're having such a rough time.  I was just diagnosed with preeclampsia 2 weeks ago and I'm also 34 weeks along.  I was given the beta-methazone steroid shot about a week ago to help the baby's lungs develop since we will most likely have to be delivering him early.  I've been going into Labor and Delivery every 2 days to have my blood pressure monitored and labs drawn.  My doctor has reassured me that the baby will be fine if born now.  However, he's also trying to get me as FAR ALONG as possible without causing harm to my health or the baby's health (with preeclampsia it can be even more dangerous to keep the baby in than getting him out).  Having said that, though, my doc said, "No one wants to see a baby born at 34 weeks. So let's try and get you further along."Hang in there.

the last few weeks are always hard on your body, take rest when you can and if poss lie on our left side as this gets optimum blood flow to your bub. Also start drinking chamomile T, it can be an aquired taste but if you can get about 5 cups a day into you it does work wonders at relaxing  you, if you dont like the taste put a t-spoon of honey in it, also bach flo wer remedys can do wonder, rescue remedy is good, just a couple of drops under your tounge or in water and than can be of help as well. . I know it can be hard to try not to stress but your baby will thank you for it as sometimes when the mum is stressed alot, you can have a very stressed baby when born due to all the adrenalin, I hope some of this is helpful to you

question: I am 34 weeks and having a lot of complications. I have a lot of stress in my life I have to have a c section I have had labor stopped twice my doctor wont stop it again I have had the shots to have him develop faster I'm extremely hot all the time as well as being tired I pee like every 15 minutes i'm 1cm dilated he is really low and and in pain all the time my back stomach feet legs head i want to know what to do to make this go faster
title: need help
